docs.snippet: Before starting on his trip to inspect the drought-ravaged States, President ROOSEVELT declared that there would be absolutely no politics in it. No one has questioned the sincerity of this announced intention. The President would feel the shrinki...
docs.lead_paragraph: Before starting on his trip to inspect the drought-ravaged States, President ROOSEVELT declared that there would be absolutely no politics in it. No one has questioned the sincerity of this announced intention. The President would feel the shrinking of any public man with a fine sense of propriety from the thought of trying to make political capital out of a national calamity.

docs.snippet: BISMARCK, N.D., Aug. 27. -President Roosevelt today changed radically the schedule for his tour of the drought regions in order to go to Salt Lake City and attend funeral services there on Tuesday for Secretary Dern....
docs.abstract: changes schedule due to Sec Dern's death

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: BISMARCK, N.D., Aug. 27. -President Roosevelt today changed radically the schedule for his tour of the drought regions in order to go to Salt Lake City and attend funeral services there on Tuesday for Secretary Dern.

headline.main: Death of Dern Alters Roosevelt Plans; Des Moines Meeting Will Be Held Thursday

docs.snippet: HYDE PARK, N.Y., Aug. 4. -President Roosevelt turned momentarily today from a detailed study of drought relief and its cost to criticize sharply those who have pictured his proposed inspection trip into the West as a political tour....
docs.abstract: rebukes foes who charge "politics" in proposed trip

byline.original: By CHARLES W. HURDSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: HYDE PARK, N.Y., Aug. 4. -President Roosevelt turned momentarily today from a detailed study of drought relief and its cost to criticize sharply those who have pictured his proposed inspection trip into the West as a political tour.

headline.main: PRESIDENT REBUKES FOES WHO CHARGE 'DROUGHT POLITICS'; Linking of Partisanship to 'Misery' Is Called 'Great Disservice' to the State. CONFERS ON RELIEF COST He Finds Increased Outlays in West Partly Offset by Cuts in Industrial Areas. ROOSEVELT DENIES 'DROUGHT POLITICS'
SHOWERS FAIL TO GIVE AID; Drought Is Still Unbroken In Farming Areas of the Dakotas.

docs.snippet: ALBANY, March 19. -- All State forces have been ordered by Governor Lehman to aid sufferers from the floods, he stated today as he kept in constant touch with New York areas where the high waters have menaced lives and property. Further, he has as...
docs.abstract: Comments on Gov Lehman's message in reply to Assemblyman Heck's resolution seeking State aid for flood victims

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, March 19. -- All State forces have been ordered by Governor Lehman to aid sufferers from the floods, he stated today as he kept in constant touch with New York areas where the high waters have menaced lives and property. Further, he has asked President Roosevelt for "full Federal assistance."

headline.main: Flood Relief Plans Speeded; LEHMAN REQUESTS FEDERAL FLOOD AID All State Forces Are Mustered to Help Sufferers by Order of Governor. DAMAGE SURVEY STARTED Executive, Replying to Republican Demands, Reveals He Had Taken Steps Asked.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Dec. 26. -- The cargo aboard the New-York and Cuba Mail Steamship Company's steamer Seneca, which was scuttled, in this port Sunday night, after putting back on fire, will prove an almost total loss. The action of the salt waler will cause...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Dec. 26. -- The cargo aboard the New-York and Cuba Mail Steamship Company's steamer Seneca, which was scuttled, in this port Sunday night, after putting back on fire, will prove an almost total loss. The action of the salt waler will cause the hemp on board of her to turn black, and the cigars, tobacco, and coffee are of course irretrievably ruined.

headline.main: THE SENECA'S CARGO RUINED.; Not Believed that the Salvage Will Amount to a Great Deal.

docs.snippet: An account of a frightful experience undergone by a shipwrecked crew and of a daring rescue during the height of a furious gale, was told yesterday when the British steamship Mohican arrived at this port. The vessel is from Swansea, sixteen days o...
docs.lead_paragraph: An account of a frightful experience undergone by a shipwrecked crew and of a daring rescue during the height of a furious gale, was told yesterday when the British steamship Mohican arrived at this port. The vessel is from Swansea, sixteen days out. She brought with her nineteen, men from the Atlantic Ocean.

headline.main: RESCUED IN A FURIOUS GALE; HEROIC WORK DONE BY THE OREW OF THE MOHICAN. The Lady Lisgard Discovered in a Sinking Condition -- The Crew's Appeal for Help -- Three Men Rescued at the first Attempt -- The Wrecked Ship Then Lost in the Gloom -- Found Again at Daybreak and All Hands Removed -- Thrilling Experiences.

docs.snippet: To the long roll of marine casualties there was yesterday added one which varies the sombre list of mishaps on the ocean of which the Atlantic has lately been so prolific. The Hamburg-American steamship Gellert arrived in port, having been two day...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the long roll of marine casualties there was yesterday added one which varies the sombre list of mishaps on the ocean of which the Atlantic has lately been so prolific. The Hamburg-American steamship Gellert arrived in port, having been two days on fire.

headline.main: FOUGHT WITH FIRE AT SEA; TWO DAYS AND NIGHTS FLAMES RAGED ON THE GELLERT. The Steamship Had 400 Passengers on Board, and Only the Coolness of the Officore Prevented a Panic -- The Fire Was in the After -- Steerage Compartment Under the Blain Saloon, and Could Not Be Reached -- Drowned Out Through Holes Cut in the Deck.

headline.main: SUNK BY THE ENERGIA.; THE WILD PIGEON WORSTED IN A COLLISION WITH A STEAMER.
